components.html: If we can't reach you, who should we contact?
components.label: Content
HTML
components.content: Check every reason that applies*

components.label: HTML
components.content:
The federal Fair Housing Act bans discrimination in housing (and housing-related transactions) based on seven characteristics. These are called protected classes.

  1. Race
    2. Race refers to categories people are grouped into based on their shared physical qualities. The U.S. Census Bureau defines these racial categories in the U.S.:
    • White
    • Black or African American descent
    • Asian
    • American Indian or Alaska Native
    • Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
    • a mixture of two or more of these groups

  2. Color
    3. Color refers to your skin color or tone. While race and color overlap, they are not the same. Within a single race, skin color can vary.

    You can experience discrimination based on your skin color even if the person discriminating against you is of the same race.

  3. Religion
    4. Religion refers to your practice (or non-practice) of a specific religion. Examples: Hinduism, Judaism, Islam, Christianity, Buddhism.

  4. Sex
    5. Sex refers to your gender. It also includes sexual harassment.

    Sexual orientation and gender identity

    We encourage you to file a complaint if you experienced housing discrimination because of your sexual orientation or gender identity.

    The federal Fair Housing Act does not currently include protections for sexual orientation or gender identity. However, many states ban discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity.

    Learn more about housing discrimination if you identify as LGBTQ+.

  5. National origin (ancestry or ethnicity)
    6. National origin refers to your birthplace, ethnicity, ancestry, culture, and language.

    If you experienced discrimination because you speak with an accent or you speak a language other than English, it is discrimination based on national origin.

    NOTE: The federal Fair Housing Act protects all U.S. residents, regardless of immigration or citizenship status. We will not ask about your immigration status, and we will not disclose any information about you to immigration authorities.

  6. Disability
    7. Disability refers to a mental or physical impairment that substantially limits one or more of your major life activities. Major life activities include actions like seeing, hearing, speaking, walking, breathing, performing manual tasks, caring for one’s self, or working.

  7. Familial status (or status as a family with children under 18 years old)
    8. Familial status refers to having a child under 18 years old as a member of your household. It also includes women who are pregnant and families in the process of adopting children.

components.label: Because of my race or skin color or because:
components.description:
• Someone thinks I'm specific race or have a specific skin color
  • I'm associated with someone of a specific race or skin color

components.label: Because of my religion or because:
components.description:
• Someone thinks I'm a member of a specific religion
  • I'm associated with someone of a specific religion

components.label: Because of my national origin (ancestry or ethnicity) or because:
components.description:
• Someone thinks I'm from a specific country or part of the world
  • I'm associated with someone of a specific national origin

components.label: Because of my sex or because I was sexually harassed
Because I have a disability or because:
components.description:
• Someone thinks I have a disability
  • I'm associated with someone who has a disability

components.label: Because I have family with children under 18 years old or because:
components.description:
• I'm pregnant
  • I'm a foster parent or adopting children under 18 years old
  • Someone thinks I have a family with children under 18 years old

components.label: Date

validate.customMessage: By law, we can only investigate discrimination that happened in the last year. If the last date you experienced discrimination was over a year ago, Font Awesome Icons call your nearest HUD fair housing office for more information.

components.errorLabel: A date within the last year
